page.title: 11RELIGION HALWELL & MORELEIGH
page.content: The Churches of St. Leonard at Halwell and All Saints at Moreleigh play an important and unifying part in the life of the two villages. The Church festivals during the year give ample scope for gatherings such as Harvest Suppers, flower festivals, socials and fund raising events. In 1844 an independent Non-Conformist Chapel was built but it is now unused and derelict. St. Leonar's Church Halwell was built in perpendicular style in the late 15th C. and substantially added to in 1897.Its six bells were recast in 1763 from a previous peal of four. All Saints' Church Moreleigh is reputed to have been built as a penance for the killing of the Rector of Woodleigh in a quarrel. It was restored in the late 19thC and again in 1934.
